definitions.definition: ( uncountable ) A specialized animal tissue with high lipid content, used for long-term storage of energy: fat tissue.
examples: Mammals that hibernate have plenty of fat to keep them warm during the winter.

subdefinitions.definition: Such tissue as food: the fatty portion of (or trimmings from) meat cuts.
examples: Ask the butcher for a few pounds of fat for our greens.

definitions.definition: ( countable ) A lipid that is solid at room temperature, which fat tissue contains and which is also found in the blood circulation ; sometimes, a refined substance chemically resembling such naturally occurring lipids.
examples: Dietary fat is not the evil that it was once misapprehended to be; carbs are increasingly recognized as a bigger driver of atherosclerosis via chronic insulin resistance and the vascular processes that cascade from it.

definitions.definition: That part of an organization deemed wasteful.
examples: We need to trim the fat in this company
I saw Daniel crack a fat .

definitions.definition: ( golf ) A poorly played shot where the ball is struck by the top part of the club head. (see also thin , shank , toe )
The best or richest productions; the best part.
examples: to live on the fat of the land

definitions.definition: ( dated , printing ) Work containing much blank , or its equivalent, and therefore profitable to the compositor .
A beef cattle fattened for sale.

definitions.definition: A large tub or vessel for water, wine, or other liquids; a cistern .
A dry measure , generally equal to nine bushels.

main_definition: ( obsolete ) A large tub or vessel for water, wine, or other liquids; a cistern .
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete ) A dry measure , generally equal to nine bushels.
